intro: Lastrea sparsa, commonly known as the sparse lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowering adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its leaves are small, cylindrical, and often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring or early summer.
